definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: You'll have to go and ask the vicar if he'll marry you in church.
sentences.chinese: 你得去問一問牧師看是否願意爲你在教堂內證婚。

sentences.english: The civil marriage also requires the presences to two witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 民事婚姻也要求兩個證婚人在場。

sentences.english: She was married by a man ten years younger.
sentences.chinese: 是指爲她證婚的牧師，比她小十歲。

sentences.english: But Valentine would secretly marry young men that came to him.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓦倫廷祕密地爲找上門的年輕人證婚。

sentences.english: They were married by a bishop.
The registrar said she'd never seen such a happy wedding.
sentences.chinese: 證婚人說，她從未見過如此開心的婚禮。

sentences.english: Eastern Europe witnesses the ceremony hall classic, elegant and dignified.
sentences.chinese: 東歐經典婚禮殿堂證婚儀式，優雅而莊重。
一位老朋友爲他們證婚。

sentences.english: At their wedding ceremony, the old bureau chief was their chief witness.
sentences.chinese: 在他們的結婚儀式上，由老所長給他倆做證婚人。

definition: student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
Hong Kong Wetland Park, in Yuen Long, New Territories
pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Shi1 di4 Gong1 yuan2
